answers.answer: Hi,What are the symptoms present? The C-Reactive Protein test is a general test to check for inflammation in the body.  A more sensitive CRP test, called a high-sensitivity C-reactive protein (hs-CRP) assay may be done  to determine a person's risk for heart disease. It is best that you discuss the results also with your doctor for proper evaluation. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: I am 31 years old and my kidney functioning has gone down 30 points in 2 years (multiple tests from different labs confirm this).  It went from 84 to 51.  I have a fluctuating hcrp level of anywhere from 4 to 13.1 to 5.2 to 9.1 (some of these within a matter of 3 days testing).  They have ruled out that the reduction in kidney functioning is related to diabetes.
title: high c reactive proteins and decrease in kidney
